sermons.title: (Daniel: The Man God Uses #3) Manifestation of Christ
sermons.description: When is the "power of the fire" quenched in our lives?  The two things that turned King Nebuchadnezzar's head were the liberty and the fellowship these saints had with the Son of God.  The good news is that the Christian life will never become more difficult than chapter one--setting one's heart to please God and not defile oneself.

sermons.title: (Forging the Vessel of Recovery) 6- Recovery of Real Faith
(Genesis) - Part 19
sermons.description: The birth of Isaac came at the end of Abraham and Sarah laying hold of God by faith despite their ups and downs.  Isaac and Isaac contrast believers under the old covenant (done in the strength of the flesh) and those of the new covenant, that which is done supernaturally.  God's tests come to see whether He is first in our life.  Abraham went against human reason, counted the cost, and obeyed God in offering Isaac, the first mention of worship and also a picture of the resurrection.

sermons.title: (Hebrews - Part 34): Noah Dared to Believe God
(Hebrews - Part 35): How Abraham Knew He Was Called
(Hebrews - Part 37): Faith is a Pertubing Thing
(Hebrews) 2-Moses
sermons.description: Faith not only moves mountains and secures heaven's blessings; it makes obedience possible. Our obedience, like everything else in the Christian life, is by the faith of the Son of God. By faith Moses' parents sent him down the Nile in a basket, because without God's intervention the child would certainly have died. By faith Moses chose the affliction of the people of God, forsaking the pleasures of sin and the riches of Egypt, because he trusted the Lord to make him a partaker of the riches of Christ. Faith "reckons, risks and rests" - and secures God's promises, sometimes by doing what is foolish in the eyes of the world. Such obedience can only arise from confidence in God to keep his promises, regardless of appearances.

sermons.title: (Hebrews) 3-Cain and Abel
sermons.description: "By faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained witness that he was righteous." Abel was the first to be saved by faith, and the first martyr. Abel's sacrifice was a work of faith; Cain's was not. Symbolically, the Lord had respect to Abel and his offering of the firstlings of the flock because without the shedding of blood there is no remission of sins. Cain offered the fruit of the earth, which is under the curse of sin. Nothing originating from sinful nature can be made acceptable to God. Only that which arises from faith in Christ and His shed blood is pleasing to the Father.

sermons.title: (Hebrews) 5-Abel and Enoch
sermons.description: A brief exhortation to follow the examples of Abel and Enoch, who by faith became witnesses to the truth that God is the rewarder of those who diligently seek Him.

sermons.title: (Hebrews) 6-Noah
sermons.description: "And as it was in the days of Noah, so shall it be also in the days of the Son of man." We live in an age in which living the Christ-life and keeping His commandments is almost as outlandish as building an ark in the desert! Noah was "moved by fear" at the word of the Lord and became a preacher of righteousness (2 Peter 2:5). Such men are needed today!

sermons.title: (Hebrews) 8-Faith
sermons.description: This final message summarizes and recapitulates the entire series in a sweeping biblical survey showing that without faith it is impossible to please God, but all things are possible to him who believes!

sermons.title: (People God Uses) 02 The Need for Faith
sermons.description: Chuck Smith continues his series on people used by God with focus on faith.  In Hebrews 11:6 we read that without faith it is impossible to please God for he who comes to God must believe that He is and He rewards those that truly seek Him.  The men and women that God uses believe in His promises and stand in faith upon those promises.  Paul reminds us in the Epistle to Romans that it is God who gives us a measure of faith (Romans 12:3).  The men and women that God uses are people of faith.

sermons.title: (So Great A Salvation) Faith-New Birth-Witness of the Spirit
(The Better Covenant) 3 - A Life of Faith
sermons.description: "To walk by faith is as much superior to walking by sight as Jesus is higher than Moses," says brother Zac.  In the new covenant we have a better life of faith like Jesus, who overcame all sin and pleased the Father from morning until night.  The root causes of failure to walk by faith are in seeing faith as something in ourselves or working hard to obtain what only God can do.  Zac shares how he tried every doctrine of holiness and failed miserably until he came to see the simplicity of biblical faith--leaning of the human personality in total confidence in God's perfect love for me.

sermons.title: 9. What is the work of creation?
A Good Report
sermons.description: This message deals with the vital necessity of faith, examining the heroic standard set by those ancient men and women listed in the eleventh chapter of Hebrews. "And these all, having obtained a good report through faith, received not the promise: God having provided some better thing for us, that they without us should not be made perfect." (Hebrews 11:39-40) Our generation is starving for men and women of this caliber of faith, but who will heed the call?

sermons.title: Childlike Faith (4 of 4)
sermons.description: We believe that these messages truly flesh out what is meant by the phrase, 'We walk by faith, not by sight.' Because 'faith' is so easily misunderstood this is a much needed truth.

sermons.title: Choosing Rather to Suffer
sermons.description: This sermon preached by Ravenhill really gets to the root of alot of the causes of why we don't have genuine revival in North America. He takes the life of moses and shows how he choosed rather to suffer for the sake of Christ then enjoy the pleasures of sin for a short time. The same thing can be asked of the church today? There are many different tangents and convicting statements brought up as the spirit of God lead brother ravenhill to speak. This is a must listen.

sermons.title: Christ in Genesis #2: Abel's Sacrifice
sermons.description: The conflict between Cain and Abel is a conflict between the flesh and faith.  Abel's faith looked for the blood of Christ to save him, whereas Cain trusted in the good works of his flesh and was rejected.  If you trust in the good works of the flesh, the murder and evil of the flesh is sure to manifest.

sermons.title: Divine Healing
sermons.description: â€œFaith cometh by hearing the word of God,â€ and God will always meet faith.  And what is faith?  Why, thatâ€™s the question: what is faith?  â€œI have not found so great faith, no, not in Israel.â€  Iâ€™m often troubled when I pray for the sick.  Just recently I had that experience again.  I met some saintsâ€”not anybody thatâ€™s here; now, donâ€™t feel bad; Iâ€™m not pointing right at you, see: somebody elseâ€”but saints.  I was praying for the sick, and talking faith, and praying faith, and God was there.  And these saints talked unbelief. Youâ€™d be surprised how much unbelief is hanging on us.  The Bible talks about â€œthe sin that doth so easily beset us.â€  It sticks to us.  Die klebt uns an.  Grad wie die Kletten; das ist Unglaube.  Itâ€™s unbelief.  And youâ€™d be surprised what mountains of unbelief there are in the saints.  You donâ€™t find it out until the cat bites them, or a dog barks at them, or something else happens and they really have to believe God.  Why, then their faith is goneâ€”absolutely gone.

sermons.title: Faith Obeys (3 of 4)
sermons.description: We believe that these messages truly flesh out what is meant by the phrase, 'We walk by faith, not by sight.' Because 'faith' is so easily misunderstood this is a much needed truth.

sermons.title: Faith unto Enlargement through Adversity - Part 2
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1954.

sermons.title: Faith unto Enlargement through Adversity - Part 3
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1954.

sermons.title: Faith unto Enlargement through Adversity - Part 5
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 04/01/1954.

sermons.title: God is a Rewarder of Those Who Seek Him (2 of 4)
sermons.description: We believe that these messages truly flesh out what is meant by the phrase, 'We walk by faith, not by sight.' Because 'faith' is so easily misunderstood this is a much needed truth.

sermons.title: God's Cure for Man's Weakness
sermons.description: GOD'S CURE FOR MAN'S WEAKNESS. DELIVERED ON SUNDAY MORNING, JUNE 24TH, 1866, BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON. “Out of weakness were made strong.”-Hebrews 11:34. SOME kinds of weakness are of God's appointment, and necessarily incident to manhood; they are not sinful, and, therefore, we may continue to be subject to them without regret. In reference to such weaknesses it may be that after beseeching the Lord even thrice to remove them, it may be for our good that they should remain. Then will our gracious God give us, in place of removing the weakness, this reply, “My grace shall be sufficient for thee.” This is a case of in weakness made strong, and there are many of God's saints who daily experience so blessed a privilege. They are weak, and continue weak; they have infirmities which they once wished to have removed, but which now they are content to bear; for now they are of the same mind with the apostle, that they glory in their infirmity, because when they are weak they are strong. But, dear friends, there is another kind of weakness which is sinful, a weakness which springs not from nature but from fallen nature; not from God's appointment, but from our sinfulness, and out of this we should desire to be delivered. We cannot pray for strength in sinful weakness, but must earnestly plead for strength to come out of it and to be made strong.

sermons.title: Hebrews 11:23-33
sermons.description: il

sermons.title: How To Be Faithful To God
sermons.description: In the last days we are warned the enemy will come against the church with a flood of lies to try and sweep her away. The devil tries to weary God's people with a constant barrage of lies and accusations, meant to wear them out, to exhaust them and take the fightÂ and the faith out of them. If he can convince you God is mad at you or doesn't care about your situation, he has already won half the battle. Faithfulness to God can only come out of a trusting, believing heart. the devil knows this and tries to hinder and discourage you with lies as you begin seeking to enter into the rest of the Lord, and spiritual blessings he has for his children.

sermons.title: How To Develop Your Life's Message
It Comes Down To Faith (1 of 4)
sermons.description: This series of 4 messages on faith was preached in Sedalia, MO at Hwy M Chapel, where Bob Jennings is a pastor. We believe that these messages truly flesh out what is meant by the phrase, 'We walk by faith, not by sight.' Because 'faith' is so easily misunderstood this is a much needed truth.

sermons.title: Joseph's Bones
sermons.description: WE cannot readily tell which action in a gracious life God may set the most store by. The Holy Spirit in this chapter selects out of good men's lives the most brilliant instances of their faith. I should hardly have expected that he would have mentioned the dying scene of Joseph's life as the most illustrious proof of his faith in God. That eventful life perhaps the most interesting in all sacred Scripture, with the exception of one, abounds with incidents, of which the Holy Spirit might have said by his servant Paul, “By faith Joseph did this and that,” but none is mentioned save the closing scene. The triumph especially of his chastity under well-known and exceedingly severe temptation, might have been very properly traced to the power of his faith, but it is passed over, and the fact that he gave commandment concerning his bones is singled out as being the most illustrious proof of his faith. Does not this tell us, dear brethren and sisters, that we are very poor judges of what God will most delight in? Very likely when we least please ourselves God is best pleased with us. That prayer over which we groaned, and thought it was not prayer, may have had more true supplication in it than...

sermons.title: Obedience of Grace - Illustrated by Noah
sermons.description: "God used Noah," explains Ed Miller, "to give us the secret of missions, obedience and the Christian life."  Brother Ed expounds how Noah (as a type of the believer) saw the ark (Christ as Savior) and that revelation consumed his life.  As the ark got bigger, the man Noah got smaller; and when he finally disappeared into the ark, the great miracle of obedience happened!  (NOTE: Pt. 2: Obedience of Faith - Illustrated by the Disciples on the Stormy Sea)

sermons.title: Risen And Returning
sermons.description: Jesus came to die to save all those who believed on Him, but He is also coming again soon. Like Noah, let's believe and trust as the time approaches.

sermons.title: The Burnt Offering
sermons.description: Here in Genesis we read of the Lord testing Abrahams faith, which is confirmed in Hebrews 11.  Isaac was to be the burnt offering which would produce a sweet smelling savour to the Lord, we see him here in the place of the lamb that bows his head instead of stiffening his neck.  Pastor Hession shows there are 3 key sayings in these verses, 1: Where is the Lamb? when we are stubborn and self willed where are the lamb like qualities in us that marked the life of our Lord?  2: God will provide Himself a Lamb,  this He did in the form of his Son, the Lord Jesus, Who was the only One Who could offer up a sweet smelling savour to God.  3: He shall be accepted for Him, here is the wonder of His substitution for us that God credits to us the sweet savour that ascended up from Calvary.

sermons.title: The Great Need Of Revival by Denny Kenaston
sermons.description: Denny Kenaston opens the revival conference with a exhortation to seek the face of God, to see what God can do! He shares the burden and reason why revival is very needful in our day. Then he preaches verse by verse through psalm 80 asking God to restore his church to God.

sermons.title: The Making Of A Worshipper
sermons.description: Worshippers aren't made in good times, or during victories. They are made in dark and stormy trials. Jacob had lived a tumultous life, with one trial after another, yet when he was old and dying, he leaned on his staff and worshipped, saying his bad times had been few, as he reflected on the faithfulness of God. God had brought him through so many things, and he will be faithful to us, too

sermons.title: The Power Of Faith - Alone With God
The Power of the Blood
sermons.description: The life is in the blood. Blood is so complex that even the scientists struggle to fully understand it. For example when you're cut, your body immediately reacts and sends the white blood cells to fight the infection. The dead white blood cells are then expelled as puss. In the same way the Blood of Christ cleanses us from all unrighteousness to counter any poison of sin that enters. The blood is like petrol that allows your body to function. The other members of the body remains in its place, but the blood is present right through your body. The blood also carries oxygen throughout your body. It also gets rid of impurities and acts like a refuse remover. We speak so glibly about the Blood of Christ, little realising what it does. It brings us life and that's why the devil hates it.

sermons.title: Touching the Tears of Failure
sermons.description: November 9, 2008 - The plan of God is not hindered in our life because of our failures and frailties. We will be brought into an incredible battle through the events of our life. Questions will bombard our mind such as, "Have I grieved you? Did I miss God? Did I really hear from God?" Through this time of discouragement God is working behind the scenes and like living water that can flow through every hindrance, He will bypass our failures and frailties and bring us into His divine purpose and plan. When we see Jesus at the end of our journey He will begin to wipe away all our tears. We are going to a place where there is no sorrow or pain, so take heart!

sermons.title: Trust In Christ Is Everything
sermons.description: A message of separation focusing on our trust in God and in laying down that which is dearest to our heart, our sense of purpose and value is not here in this world, it's in Christ alone. This is a great exhortation on the overcoming power of our in-dwelling God.
